This is inspired by the Pepsi VS Coke poll.
 This is a poll for fast food joints.
 Before we begin, this is fun. Yes I know too much fast food is not good for you. Yes I know frechfries are bad. Oh, gosh I know they're bad for you. That said, let me know what would be your fast food place of choice. There should also be a poll. And remember, keep it fun.
 With that...I like Arbey's. I can get a thinly sliced rost beef sandwich or a Market Fresh Chicken Salad Sandwich (both without any greese at all. The meat is not fired.) I also get a fruit punch drink with no caffine, no carbonation, and contains 100% juice (or at least vitamin C) so there. It's possible to eat something healthy. emoticon_xhoho
jim's trucking

This is inspired by the Pepsi VS Coke poll.
 This is a poll for fast food joints.
 Before we begin, this is fun. Yes I know too much fast food is not good for you. Yes I know frechfries are bad. Oh, gosh I know they're bad for you. That said, let me know what would be your fast food place of choice. There should also be a poll. And remember, keep it fun.
 With that...I like Arbey's. I can get a thinly sliced rost beef sandwich or a Market Fresh Chicken Salad Sandwich (both without any greese at all. The meat is not fired.) I also get a fruit punch drink with no caffine, no carbonation, and contains 100% juice (or at least vitamin C) so there. It's possible to eat something healthy. emoticon_xhoho
Checker's, Krystal, Dairy Queen, Mrs. Winners, Sonic, Chic-Fil-A, The Varsity (available only in God's country), any drive-thru liquor store...all of these places beat the ones on your list...and I think it's Arby's!
 
 Some of the fast fat places have started offering fruit cups and fruit bowls...all are overpriced and the fruit is soaked in chemicals to make them stay invitingly colorful for months.
 
 I eat Egg McMuffins from MacDonald's, Egg & Cheeze Croissants from Burger King and that's about it. If I want a fat-laden cheeseburger, I'll cook it over a hickory fire in my own backyard and enjoy a high-calorie twelve pack while I'm waiting.
 
 http://www.fatcalories.com/
 
 Check 'em out!

My fast food of choice??????????
 Subway emoticon_xhohoBTW A&W had a restauraunt up in Malone, NY. I remember going there whn I was a kid. We returned to my grandparent's trailer in St. Regis Falls, NY with a GLASS gallon jug of A&W root beer that was to die for :) :)
Matthew S

Some of the fast fat places have started offering fruit cups and fruit bowls...all are overpriced and the fruit is soaked in chemicals to make them stay invitingly colorful for months.
 
 

 
 
 That not quite true. The fruit at wendy's comes allready chopped and only has a 3-5 day hold time. The fruit bowls and cups are made twice a day and the left overs are thrown out every night. There are no chemicals added to any of the fruit.
georged

That not quite true. The fruit at wendy's comes allready chopped and only has a 3-5 day hold time. The fruit bowls and cups are made twice a day and the left overs are thrown out every night. There are no chemicals added to any of the fruit.

 
 And the fruit is grown without chemicals? We pay a premium for fruit and vegetables grown organically, often a substantial premium depending on season, but taste is far, far superior to most commercial offerings. I'd think logistics and the motivation behind consumption at their facilities will prevent fast food joints from ever becoming icons of healthy eating. 
 
 I ate some fast food while working at a regular job, but my wife, probably one of the few Americans who has never eaten at a McDonald's and a superior cook, makes sure there's always something at home denying even consideration of going to a fast food joint for anything other than a deli piled high hot pastrami with swiss on dill rye.

 You may have just ruined my breakfast Jim, but you may have also saved my life at the same time, so I will forgive you. emoticon_xclown 
 
 I don't have the luxery of making a real fire in my back yard, Philadelphia is kinda funny about that. But I do often get fresh cherry wood chips and soak them in either apple brandy or dry white wine, and then throw them on top of natural wood charcoal. Now that makes a burger! BTW Jim, what is your favorite brand of 12 pack? I like Yuengling Premium.
